page.title: 16TOURISM AROUND NENTHEAD
page.content: The area has very limited facilities for tourists.They can stay at the "Miner's Arms" and "The Crown" Public House Hotels in the village or they can stay in Bed & Breakfast houses or on a caravan site at the"Horse & Wagon"<P.H. G.R.764452> Attempts are being made to restore some lead mining remnants and to fetch them to the public's attention.This has been done successfully at Killhope Wheel 4mls away in Co. Durham.A mining museum and model railway is under con- struction at Hagg's mine by the Horse & Wagon.Car parking facilities and a picnic area are being established at Hagg's by Eden District Council.In July 1985 Â£20000 has been made available to survey the possible dev- elopment of Rampsgill ancient mining monument as a tourist attraction.<G.R. 784432>.
